NDSH
Table of Contents

Enum DegreesTypeDirection

Namespace
NDSH.Geospatial.Gml.Measures
Assembly
NDSH.Geospatial.Metadata.ISO19115.Ed2003.dll

Enumerates the directional or sign indicators applicable to a DegreesType measurement. This reflects the cardinal (N, E, S, W) or sign (+, -) choices specified in the deprecated GML DegreesType.

public enum DegreesTypeDirection
Extension Methods
ExtensionMethods.GetXmlEnumName<T>(T)
ExtensionMethods.GetXmlEnumAttributeOrName<T>(T)
ExtensionMethods.GetXmlEnumAttribute<T>(T)

Fields

East = 1

Indicates an eastern direction (E).

Minus = 5

Indicates a negative sign (-).

North = 0

Indicates a northern direction (N).

Plus = 4

Indicates a positive sign (+).

South = 2

Indicates a southern direction (S).

West = 3

Indicates a western direction (W).

Remarks

In the context of the GML schema, these values indicate the direction for a degrees measurement (e.g., latitude, longitude, bearing). Although marked as deprecated in the schema, they remain supported for backward compatibility with older GML datasets.
